body.p:
The following day, Mr. Jones arrived.
⁊c̃ Full: et cetera
dĩ Full: dei
grã Full: gratia
ꝑ Full: per
eccl̃ia Full: ecclesia
p̾benda Full: prebenda
tempꝰ Full: tempus
capitl̃i Full: capituli
Eboraceñ Full: Eboracensis
dño Full: domino
Wichtoñ Full: Wighton
Dunolm̃ Full: Dunelm
nr̃e Full: nostre
ꝑpetuo Full: perpetuo
lib̃alit̾ Full: liberaliter

It was a diplomatic matter, one that required finesse and tact. The full version of the phrase was et cetera, but in this context, it was shortened to dĩ for brevity's sake.
The lord requested an audience with the bishop, and as they entered the grand hall, he was greeted by the gratia of the ecclesia, the collective body of priests and clergy. The prebenda, a benefice or church living, was conferred upon him as a mark of esteem.
As they made their way to the throne room, the lord couldn't help but feel a sense of nostalgia wash over him. He had spent many years in Eboracensis, the Diocese of York, and it felt like a second home to him. His domino, or coat of arms, was emblazoned on his surcoat, a symbol of his noble lineage.
The bishop, seated upon his throne, smiled warmly at the lord's arrival. "Ah, my dear lord," he said, "I trust your journey here was uneventful?" The lord replied, grateful for the courtesy, that it had been a pleasant one indeed.
As they spoke, the lord's thoughts turned to the matters at hand. He had come to seek the bishop's counsel on a matter of great import, one that required careful consideration and wise deliberation. He had brought with him a copy of the capituli, the decrees of the ecclesia, which he hoped would provide guidance in his decision-making.
The bishop listened attentively as the lord presented his case, offering words of wisdom and advice along the way. As they spoke, the lord felt a sense of gratitude for the bishop's presence in his life, and for the perpetuo bond of brotherhood that united them.
Finally, after much discussion and deliberation, the matter at hand was resolved. The lord departed the bishop's presence feeling grateful and relieved, his thoughts now clearer on the path ahead.
